Pre-Game Insights: South Africa has a strong batting lineup with players like Quinton de Kock, Aiden Markram, and Heinrich Klaasen in good form.
Bangladesh needs to improve their batting performance to compete against South Africa's strong top order.
The pitch at Wankhede Stadium is batting-friendly, and South Africa has a history of high scores there.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa and Bangladesh have a 2-2 head-to-head record in the World Cup, with Bangladesh winning in 2019.
This is Bangladesh's first match at Wankhede Stadium since 1998.
Others: The match is significant as it could impact Bangladesh's journey in the World Cup, given their current standing in the points table.
